question: Is there a dress code?
answer: We suggest black tie optional or cocktail attire! Weather permitting, the ceremony will be outside so dress accordingly.

question: Can I bring a date?
answer: While we wish that we could invite everyone, if your invitation does not include "and guest" we'd prefer if it'd just be you.

question: Can I bring a different plus one?
answer: Of course! You can bring who ever you like that you will have a good time with and will enjoy the festivities of the day. We ask that you do not bring more than the allotted guest(s) for your party/family.

question: Are children welcome?
answer: Of course! Your invitation should state "and family" if we are expecting more than just you and your partner.

question: Do I have to RSVP?
answer: Yes please. We need a close to accurate count to share with the caterer and venue. We'd love to have you join us and just want to make sure we're ready for you!

question: How do I RSVP?
answer: You may RSVP with the RSVP card provided in the formal invitations. If for some reason something changes, please don't hesitate to call, text, or email the bride and groom.

question: Is there parking around the venue?
answer: Yes! There are parking spaces surrounding the venue. If you do not feel comfortable driving home, we ask that call a Lyft/Uber or have a designated driver. Please pick your vehicles up from the venue before 8 am the following Monday.

question: What time should I arrive at the ceremony?
answer: We ask that you arrive at least 15-20 minutes prior to the start of the ceremony so that you may sign in and get a good seat. Our ceremony will start promptly.

question: Will the cocktail social and reception be an open bar?
answer: Yes! We will serving wine, beer, and a signature cocktail. We ask that you drink responsibly and call a Lyft/Uber or have a designated driver if you do not feel as if you can drive home.

question: Are you registered? Where?
answer: Visit the "Registry" tab to see where we are registered! We thank you for adding to our future home!

question: How many guests will be attending?
answer: We will be monitoring the COVID cases prior to sending on invitations to ensure our guest count complies with regulations. However, our venue can accommodate 240 guests while being able to social distance.

question: Will the ceremony and reception be indoors or outdoors?
answer: Weather permitting, our ceremony will be outdoors and our reception will be indoors. If you feel more comfortable being outside throughout the whole event, there is a large patio area outside.

question: Will you encourage social distancing?
answer: Yes. All tables for the reception will be placed 6 ft apart and the seating arrangements will be by household as much as possible. There will also be markers placed on the dance floor as a visual reminder to distance.

question: How will food and drinks be served?
answer: Food will be served plated style to ensure safety. Desserts will be self-serve but will all be individually packaged. For the first round of drinks during cocktail hour, staff will come around to each table to get drink orders to ensure large lines do not form at the bar. After the first round is served, guests are welcome to go up to the bar.

question: Are masks required?
answer: Yes! Masks must be worn at all times during the ceremony and reception unless seated at a table.

question: Will there be any high-risk guests?
answer: Due to the nature of a wedding, there will likely be high-risk guests attending. If you consider yourself to be high-risk, we highly encourage you to be vaccinated two weeks prior to attending. For all guests, if at any point in time you feel sick or believe you may have been exposed to COVID-19, please do NOT attend our wedding and let us know at your earliest convenience.

question: Will you be live streaming?
answer: Likely yes! We are still unsure of the logistics around this option but plan on providing it.
